user: How can you create a new frame with no parent frame in Actian 4GL OpenROAD Openframe Statement?
assistant:
You can create a new frame with no parent frame like this:
```
childframe = openframe child_frame();
```
where 'child_frame' is the name of your new frame. This will open the frame on top of any other frames currently open in your application and set its ParentFrame attribute to null. You can then use this frame as you would any other object in your code, such as setting properties or calling methods on it.

user: How can you close an open frame in Actian 4GL OpenROAD Openframe Statement?
assistant:
You can close an open frame like this:
```
childframe.close();
```
where 'child_frame' is the name of your child frame. This will destroy all objects in the frame and release any memory allocated to it. After closing a frame, you cannot use its reference again unless you create another one with the same name.
